column2: Roles & Responsibilities 1. Read RFPs and requirements for the project and prepare solution involving solution document, hardware sizing, compliances, and BOQs 2. Discuss, explain, and sell the solution to customers, partners, and consultants. Explain the unique propositions in the solution. 3. Discuss and give feedback to the Products team for feature enhancements, market requirements, trends, and changing customer requirements. 4. Perform competition analysis for various solutions available in the market 5. Meet and conduct technology sessions for customers, partners, and consultants 6. Maintain the documentation and various internal reports. Core Competency The candidate should have the following skills: 1. Deep understanding of the surveillance technology and the software solutions, functionalities, video analytics, storage technologies, and server hardware 2. Good understanding of systems architecture and understanding of the data flow, data size, and architecture components such as network and servers. 3. Excellent writing skills for preparing technical solutions, concept notes, and presentations. Excellent verbal communication is a must. 4. It is preferred that the candidate possesses experience in the security surveillance domain and should have worked in companies with System Integration, Consultancy, or OEM background. 5. Good understanding of the overall solutions available in the domain and the projects. 6. Excellent listening skills, a polite way of communication, and a cool temperament 7. Fair understanding of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and any diagramming tool. Educational Qualification: Degree or Diploma in Engineering with 5-10 years of industry experience. Work Experience: 1.Presales/ Solution architect while working on Projects relating to IP Surveillance using Video Management Software relating to Smart City/ Safe City/ City Surveillance/ Police/ Highways/Ports/ Enterprise/ Industrial, etc. 2. Solution designing, Proof of Concept demonstrations, and Project Management involving all elements in the Project comprising Electronic Security Products, Video Management Software, Server Sizing, DBMS, Telecom equipment, Networking, etc. Work Timings: 9 AM to 6 PM (Monday through Friday). The team member should be flexible in working hours and working days as per the workload and priorities

column2: Position Overview:  The position requires understanding of customer requirements, mapping them to Videonetics products and propose optimized solutions. The position involves presenting the solutions, technology, architectures, and design and conducting Proof of Concept demonstrations. The position involves frequent traveling to meet customers, consultants and partners. Videonetics is a large family and It is always fun working with and interacting with various internal teams. The team member will enjoy the deep technology insights one will gain working with the best brains in the industry. For more information, please visit https://www.videonetics.com/. Please also browse Videonetics Corporate Brochure and Videonetics Corporate Presentation.pdf. Roles & Responsibilities 1.Read RFPs and requirements for the project and prepare solution involving solution document, hardware sizing, compliances, and BOQs 2.Discuss, explain, and sell the solution to customers, partners, and consultants. Explain the unique propositions in the solution. 3.Discuss and give feedback to the Products team for feature enhancements, market requirements, trends, and changing customer requirements. 4.Perform competition analysis for various solutions available in the market 5.Meet and conduct technology sessions for customers, partners, and consultants 6.Maintain the documentation and various internal reports. Education, Skills & Experience: 1.Degree or Diploma in Engineering with 5-10 years of industry experience. 2.Presales/ Solution architect while working on Projects relating to IP Surveillance using Video Management Software relating to Smart City/ Safe City/ City Surveillance/ Police/ Highways/Ports/ Enterprise/ Industrial, etc. 3.Solution designing, Proof of Concept demonstrations, and Project Management involving all elements in the Project comprising Electronic Security Products, Video Management Software, Server Sizing, DBMS, Telecom equipment, Networking, etc. 4.Deep understanding of the surveillance technology and the software solutions, functionalities, video analytics, storage technologies, and server hardware 5.Good understanding of systems architecture and understanding of the data flow, data size, and architecture components such as network and servers. 6.Excellent writing skills for preparing technical solutions, concept notes, and presentations. Excellent verbal communication is a must. 7.It is preferred that the candidate possesses experience in the security surveillance domain and should have worked in companies with System Integration, Consultancy, or OEM background. 8.Good understanding of the overall solutions available in the domain and the projects. 9.Excellent listening skills, a polite way of communication, and a cool temperament 10.Fair understanding of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and any diagramming tool.

column2: Extensively work in scoping, estimation, proposal, presentations, commercials for SAP applications                                     Hands on experience in solution building, proposals writing, estimation and pricing                                     Responsible for Lead Generation in the allotted regions and converting into opportunities                                     Target driven sale of SAP technology-based solutions and commercials                                     Perform Reporting, Sales Pipeline, Campaigns, and Inside Sales and global team coordination                                     Act as the face of the company for customer and SAP discussion                                     Proposal proof-reading and documentations                                     End-to-end SAP solution design                                     Presenting solutions and options to leadership, project teams, and other stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.                                     Developing application roadmaps and implementation approaches for SAP Suite of products like S/4HANA, ECC, Ariba, Concur, BTP or SF.                                     Working with Account Managers and sales leads to understand the business requirements and priorities of CXOs and other senior stakeholders.                                     Providing guidelines and best practices on SAP S/4HANA processes.                                     Engaging with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) where appropriate.                                     Participating in SAP Bids/Tenders from customers in the Indian market.                                     Estimating and commercial modelling, including pricing and margin simulations.                                     Stakeholder management within the bid team and wider senior management.                                     Creating the solution response document(s) and draft proposals.                                     Defending solutions in front of NEC internal stakeholders as well as in front of client stakeholders.                                     Being part of the solution pursuit team during the bidding process to ensure alignment with sales, client business, and technology strategy.                                     Leveraging NEC s offerings by combining them with your in-depth industry and market knowledge, as well as your expertise in SAP solution delivery to develop the solution strategy to the customers needs and requirements.                                     Articulating clearly and concisely the transition and transformation journey for the customer to move to the proposed solution.                                     Helping to identify and create a differentiated value proposition.                                     Working as part of a larger bid team crafting a cohesive, coherent, and efficient solution where the customer needs or requirements span multiple technologies, including SAP. You will need to work closely with pre-sales teams/solution architects from other NEC Practice Areas/Growth Platforms.                                     Ensuring that solutions are aligned with org-level guidelines to enable needed internal approvals.                                     Leading solution presentations/solution defence sessions with NEC internal and customer stakeholders.                                     Working closely with our customers to understand the current business processes at a detailed level.                                     Participating in discussions with various levels of customer IT business stakeholders.                                     Developing strong client relationships by building trust, rapport, and positive working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders and team members.                                     Working with internal and customer stakeholders to create prototypes, proof of concepts, and sample mockups as a means of eliciting and defining business requirements.                                     Creating and owning user stories/business requirements documents as an outcome of the requirements gathering sessions and detailing out the user stories.                                     Analysing the data requirements, structures, and integration points of the process and creating mapping to SAP objects or external endpoints.                                     Identifying business process improvements and opportunities for automation.                                     Documenting work using flow charts, written descriptions, screenshots, and videos.                                     Applying knowledge, skills, and judgment to make decisions and resolve issues.                                     Maintaining a target billable utilization aligned to the role.                                     Being effective in working with customers, including business executives, business analysts, and IT development staff.                                     Recognizing that speed is paramount, and working nimbly to accelerate the delivery of the solution for customers.                                     Maintaining a collaborative and empathetic relationship with the business partners, which will be central to your role. Your commitment to their success should never be in doubt.                                     Work closely with the onsite sales, bid teams, and other domain SMEs to create contextual responses with a key focus on SAP Sales strategy.                                      Drive the solutioning activities for small/medium to large complex deals (5M-100M+ TCV) that involve multiple service lines and/or technology domains.                                     Define solution vision, value proposition, and transformational direction that s build on the synergies and benefits across service offers.                                     Drive the translation of complex business initiatives into innovative business-technology solutions and ensure consistency across traditional solution boundaries.                                     Work with Business Stakeholders and Delivery leads to understand the deal objectives and recommend solutions.                                     Provide expertise on commercially structuring deals to differentiate from the competition.                                     Excellent understanding of the competitor landscape, providing insight into the sales plan on how to beat the competition.                                     Work alongside SAP on both EN and NN deals, supporting them in engaging with senior-level customers in either first meetings or early stages to help shape and design early propositions, assisting in building the pipeline.                                     Ensure that the solution translated from business objectives is fit for purpose and clearly demonstrates value for money. The solution executive should be able to confidently explain this to CxO level customers.                                     Lead the delivery team, combining on-shore and off-shore solution architects to design an affordable, innovative solution that meets a clients requirements and business needs. This solution should fit within the affordability target set together with the Cloud Market Makers.                                     Consultative approach, strong business acumen, and commercial awareness, with the ability to translate business issues into relevant technical solutions and competitive propositions.                                     Fully understand the client desired business outcomes and how the transformation strategy will deliver them through a series of projects, each delivering business value.                                     Can help construct a transformation plan that is based on a business journey and walk the customer through the business value and outcomes delivered through that journey.                          Pre-Requisites:                         5+ years of working experience with Domain / Functional, SAP Delivery and Presales functions in India working with reputed MNC Firms                                     He should have 2+ Yrs experience in SAP Delivery as a Functional Consultant / Team Lead / Project Manager preferably in SAP S/4HANA Greenfield / Brownfield engagements with reputed IT MNCs in India.                                     He should have 3+ Yrs of SAP Presales / Solutioning experience working with Indian Customers with reputed IT MNCs                                     Candidate must have Client facing expertise, preferably in India market                                     SAP Functional knowledge on S/4HANA (any one primary Manufacturing / /Supply Chain / Finance etc)                                     Independently handle SAP POCs for prospects and customers working with SAP COE / Practice Teams                                     Prior experience in working with SAP Field Sales and Presales team in India.                                     Complete understanding of SAP Product Licensing (S/4HANA On Premise, RISE with SAP, PP, SAP Analytics, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAC, PPDS, EWM etc).                                     Strong in solutioning deals for SAP S/4HANA On Premise and RISE with SAP Applications.                                     Must have played SAP Solution Architect role in Pre-sales for 5 years, preferably in India domestic market with leading IT MNCs in India.                                     SAP S/4HANA Certification will be a big plus                                     Demonstrated capability to understand business strategies and application objectives, and translate those requirements into effective process designs.                                     Excellent design skills, including the ability to critique visual elements and optimize user flows.                                     Excellent written and visual communication skills, with the ability to clearly document requirements and process assets using text, diagrams, and videos.                                     Self-directed, with the ability to break down a complex process, assign actions, and manage progress toward a deadline.                                     Expertise in process modelling tools and best practices.                                     Ability to independently provide strategic vision, yet equally experienced with requirements definition, solution design, business cases development and solution implementation for clients.                                     Demonstrate ability to collaborate effectively across various stakeholders within the customer organization                                     Excellent communication and presentation skills, ability to multitask and liaise with multiple stakeholders, Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to build professional relationships, ability to identify process improvement opportunities finally adaptability to change.                                                                 Good knowledge of deal shaping and converting global opportunities into successful win                                     Ability to maintain high levels of confidentiality and Integrity.

column2: The SAP Pre-Sales Consultant plays a pivotal role in the sales process by providing expert knowledge of SAP solutions to potential clients       This role involves understanding clients business needs, recommending appropriate SAP solutions, and effectively communicating the value proposition of SAP products and services              Role and Responsibilities:               Understand clients business requirements and challenges, conducting in-depth analysis to identify opportunities where SAP solutions can add value.         Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of SAPs products and services, including ERP, CRM, BI, HANA, and other SAP applications, and be able to articulate how these solutions can address specific client needs.         Collaborate with the sales team to design tailored SAP solutions, providing cost estimates, timelines, and ROI calculations, and presenting these solutions to potential clients.         Conduct product demonstrations to showcase SAPs capabilities, features, and benefits, effectively addressing client questions and concerns.         Understand the technical aspects of SAP solutions, including integration, deployment options, and data migration, and communicate these effectively to clients.         Keep abreast of the competitive landscape and be able to position SAP solutions as superior to alternatives.         Assist in the creation of persuasive proposals and presentations that align with clients needs, emphasising the unique value of SAP solutions.         Build and maintain strong client relationships, serving as a trusted advisor throughout the pre-sales process.         Work closely with SAPs sales, product development, and technical teams to ensure seamless communication and alignment of client needs with SAPs offerings.               Eligibility Qualifications:               Bachelors degree in a relevant field (such as Business, IT, or a related discipline).          SAP certifications are a plus.         7+ years of experience in Pre-Sales experience in SAP         In-depth knowledge of SAPs product suite and an understanding of how SAP solutions can address various business challenges.         Strong sales and presentation skills, with the ability to influence and convince potential clients.         Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to convey technical information in a clear and understandable manner.         Ability to analyse client needs and develop customised solutions based on their requirements.         Understanding of the industries in which the clients operate, as well as familiarity with industry-specific SAP solutions, is advantageous.         Willingness to adapt to changing market conditions and evolving SAP offerings.         Taking end to end responsibility for various SAP opportunities, through initiation, development and successful closure.         Collaborating and coordinating with Technical, Solution, Sales, Pricing, and Operations teams to interpret client RFP requirements, and craft solutions that satisfy those requirements.         Writing responses to RFPs / high-quality, winning proposals that clearly articulate the designed solution, value proposition to the customer and differentiators.         Presenting designed solutions and proposals to the customer in a convincing and effective manner.         Contribute to designing, architecting and estimating high-quality, winning solutions for ongoing opportunities, with an emphasis on technical, functional and overall excellence.
column11: Solution sales, Retail, ERP, Data migration, SAP, Strategic partnerships, Sales process, RFP, Wholesale, CRM

column2: *Job Description*: As an International Sales Executive at Allied Technologies, you will be responsible for driving sales and revenue growth by identifying and engaging with prospective clients across the globe. Don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't have prior sales experience. - Ready to embrace night shifts and dive into the USA time zones. *Perks & Benefits:* - Competitive salary: INR 25,000 to 35,000 per month. - Flexible work-from-home setup for a harmonious work-life balance. - Opportunities for growth: We're committed to your career advancement and continuous learning.

column2: Job Description Job Title: Bench Sales Executive Location: Antra India Office, Raidurg, Hyderabad Timings: 6.00 PM to 3.00 AM IST (Night Shift) No. of Positions: Multiple. Experience: 4 - 10 years 100% work from office. Responsibilities:  Accelerate bench sales numbers, direct and assist sales people meet or exceed their KPIs and target quotas, and build Antra brand with the vendor community.  Be the forefront evangelist to ideate, communicate, and implement transformative ideas to improve and accelerate IT staffing sales and build the Antra brand.  Monitor the consultants project marketing activity regularly and implement custom ways to accelerate the staffing sales.  Develop, maintain and grow the business from our existing and new client relationships to supplement our sales capabilities.  Generate sales pipeline to pursue target and cold accounts by developing and executing    sales plan that include outbound sales communication, identifying client needs, and presenting our services.  Generate sales pipeline to pursue target and cold accounts by developing and executing    sales plan that include outbound sales communication, identifying client needs, and  presenting our services.  Collaborate with the recruiting team and qualify prospects for staffing needs considering the client requirements such as skills, experience, budgets, time frames, contract hiring history, etc. Negotiate commercial agreements and rate terms to close staffing deals. Required Qualifications:  Should have 4 - 10 years of experience in IT Bench Sales and Business Development.  Has good network of clients and vendors to immediately contribute to the productivity of the team.  Has good communication, writing, planning and organizing skills.  Possess good analytical and problem-solving skills.  Ability to roll up the sleeves to do individual contribution work, along with the team.  Has good knowledge of visa classification and tax terms (W2 / Corp to Corp / 1099).  Has the ability to market technology consultants to direct clients, tier 1 vendor partners.  Has good listening and persuasive skills and ability to overcome objections.

column2: 8-15 years of experience of working with the sales team to achieve the assigned sales targets through new customer acquisition, and sales to existing customers      Solution Knowledge: Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations with minimum 5 years implementation/presales experience in D365 Cloud Platform. MB310/330/700      Preferred Education B.E., B. Tech, MBA or (CA/CFA/CPA)      Good presentation and English Communication skills.      Experience in translating customer requirements, providing solution, preparing documents/proposals, estimating efforts and planning projects.      Ability to work as an Individual Contributor        Travel is a Mandatory    ;    US-B1 (existing) required          What you need to do:          Product Positioning    - The company has a wide portfolio of service offerings      Industry segments, Functionality requirements, Budgets.      Presales has to decide which product to position in each account in order to meet the requirements of the customer and win the sale.        Product Demonstrations and Proof of Concept Presentations    - This is the most important role of presales. The product should be presented to the prospect in a convincing manner. The prospect should develop confidence that the product will meet his requirements while understanding its limitations.      Consulting strength of the company will also be evaluated during these demonstrations. Presales should showcase this prowess by providing solutions instantly during the demonstrations, presenting real-life situations and examples and winning the confidence of the prospect.      Presentations should be well-prepared and interactions with the prospect should be arranged in advance by the sales team to facilitate readiness.        Product Expertise and Updates-    Presales should continuously learn on the job. This involves      Learning new modules and subjects      Identifying and positioning add-on solutions to complement the default offering      Learning new versions and enhancements to the products      Reading about case studies and global deployments      Constant review of vendor portals (PartnerSource) for important updates and material.        Product Mix in sales    -The company cannot rely on one or more solutions for all its business. This is risky for the business. It is important to balance time and effort in a way that all solutions are positioned to the relevant prospects.      Effort estimation ( with Team Consultation) - Proposals usually contain the following elements :        Licenses          Implementation Services          Maintenance and Ongoing Support          Implementation Services    should be estimated by presales and supported by a Project Plan to explain the break-up of activities. Project Planning is critical to estimation of efforts and should be reviewed thoroughly before submission. All aspects of the project and expectations of the customer should be met. Customization efforts, if visible, should be estimated and quantified. In the absence of this information from the client, the proposal should exclude customization or contain a reasonable estimate of the same (with a clause for review) based on past experience with similar businesses. Additional time commitment from presales to scope this better is welcomed.        Project Plans    -Project Plans and the initial workshop schedule is the responsibility of presales until the site is handed over to the Project Consultant. The initial workshop schedule when finalized and the tentative plan for the remaining project is the basis for allocation of the Project Consultant and team to the site.        Requests for Proposals    -Assist the sales team in responses to RFPs and tender documents. Our scope of work revolves around the project plan, functional requirements, estimates , methodology and scope of work.        Project Handover-    Presales should conduct a meeting involving the salesperson and the PM/Head of Delivery to hand over the project. The agenda of this meeting should cover :      1.About the project (business nature, requirements, customizations identified, unique features required, modules to be implemented) ;      2.Commercials of the contract (Value, Licenses, Man-hours, Terms, Penalties, Onsite-Offsite Support)      3.Project Plan agreed with the customers      4.Workshop Dates confirmed with the customer      5. Project team profile of the customer      6. Any recommendations and suggestions          Project Transition    - It is important to transition cases smoothly and seamlessly to the Project Team. This involves assessment of readiness for the project; issuing guidance to the customer to form the core team for the project; preparing them for the project ; attending the initial workshops;      Once the project team has taken over and the project is underway, then Presales resource can disengage from project activities.        Project Scope Reviews    -The Presales resource should remain on the Steering Committee of the project. Presales should attend review meetings/steering committee meetings with the customer periodically and engage in discussions involving changes in scope and understanding.        Change Requests and Additional Requirements    - Presales should work with the Account Consultant post-implementation to identify and propose additional work to enhance the customer experience while generating additional revenue to the company.        Customer Escalations    - Presales should assist the delivery and sales teams in handling escalations
column11: Customer acquisition, Sales, Consulting, Transition, Effort estimation, Support services, Presales, Project planning, Microsoft Dynamics, Customer experience

column2: Department:  Sales Reports  Job Type:  Full-Time Job  Overview:  We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Indoor Sales Consultant to join our dynamic sales team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sales, excellent communication skills, and a strong ability to build and maintain relationships with customers.  As an Indoor Sales Consultant, you will be responsible for understanding customer needs, and promoting Sunbaby's School Classroom Furniture to drive sales growth. Key Responsibilities:  Customer Interaction:  Understand customer needs and recommend appropriate products and services. Provide a detailed product information and demonstrations. Achieve and exceed sales targets. Develop and maintain strong relationships with new and existing customers. Identify and pursue new sales opportunities through various channels.  Product Knowledge:  Maintain a comprehensive understanding of our products and services. Qualifications:  Proven experience in sales or a customer-facing role. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to understand and respond to customer needs. Self - motivated with a results-driven approach. Ability to work well in a team and independently. Basic computer skills, including familiarity with CRM software. A bachelors degree in Any field. Preferred Skills:  Experience in the furniture required in Classroom within Schools. Working Conditions: This position is primarily based indoors in office environment.   How to Apply:  Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience and why they would be a good fit for this role to: sonali@sunbabyindia.com
column11: Indoor Sales, Customer Relationship, Customer Interaction, Relationship Building, Sales Consulting, CRM

column2: About Company: Bajaj Electricals Limited is a globally renowned Indian Consumer Appliances and Lighting Solutions company (its Power Transmission and Distribution projects business has been demerged to form Bajel Projects Limited). Headquartered in Mumbai with a turnover of INR 5,429 crores (FY 22-23), it is a part of the $100 bn multinational conglomerate Bajaj Group founded by Shri Jamnalal Bajaj. The Company was established in 1938 and has stood the test for almost 85 years. It continues to enjoy consumer trust across various sectors it operates in and remains at the forefront of developing modern, technologically superior and aesthetic products and solutions.  Bajaj Electricals business portfolio spans Consumer Products (Appliances, Fans, Cookware) and Lighting Solutions (Consumer and Professional Lighting). They are a front runner in the industry with their key brand offerings comprising BAJAJ, Nirlep, Morphy Richards and Nex. They have an expansive network of 18 branch offices, 660+ distributors, and ~ 2 lakh retail outlets across India, combined with over 620 consumer care centres reaching 19,000 pin codes, fortifying their dominant presence in the consumer products sector. Under their Lighting Solutions business, they offer a wide range of innovative LED lamps and fixtures, including panels and battens, to consumers and are known for their prowess in street lighting, sports lighting, industrial commercial and infrastructural lighting, and undertaking specialised illumination projects on a turnkey basis amongst other solutions.  The Company believes in creating happiness with sustainability by focusing on the four key CSR pillars - Sustainability, Diversity & Inclusion, Employee Volunteering & Community Initiatives. Through their CSR initiatives, they enable sustained impact in environmental sustainability, education, health, arts & culture and community development achieved by direct implementation and via NGO partners. Website:  http://www.bajajelectricals.com Industry:  Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing Headquarters:  Mumbai, Maharashtra Founded:  1938 Address:  27th Floor, One Unity Center, Tower 4, Senapati Bapat Marg, Prabhadevi/ Parel (West) Specialties:  Consumer Products, Illumination, Power Distribution, lighting, and Solar Position:  SAP GRC and Basis Administrator Job Summary: The SAP GRC and Basis Administrator is responsible for the configuration, maintenance, and support of SAP systems, with a focus on Governance, Risk, and Compliance functionalities. This role involves ensuring the stability, security, and compliance of SAP systems while providing technical support to users and stakeholders. Key Responsibilities: SAP GRC Implementation and Support: Configure and maintain SAP GRC components such as Access Control, Process Control,       and Risk Management. Design and implement GRC workflows, rulesets, and risk mitigation strategies. Monitor and analyze access risks, segregation of duties (SoD) conflicts, and       compliance violations. Develop and maintain GRC reports and dashboards for management and audit       purposes. Compliance and Regulatory Support: Collaborate with  audit and compliance teams to ensure SAP systems meet       regulatory requirements. Implement and enforce security policies, procedures, and controls within SAP       environments. Conduct periodic audits and assessments of SAP systems to identify and remediate       compliance issues. SAP Basis Administration: Install, configure,  and maintain SAP systems and related components. Perform system upgrades, patches, and migrations. Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement performance tuning       measures. Manage user access and security settings within SAP systems. Provide technical support and guidance to end-users, system administrators, and       developers. Manage change requests, incidents, and service requests related to SAP systems. Coordinate       with cross-functional teams, including IT, security, and business       stakeholders, to achieve project objectives. Skills and Qualifications: - Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field. - SAP certifications in Basis and/or GRC (preferred). - Hands-on 4-5 years of experience with SAP GRC components such as Access Control, Process Control, and Risk Management. - Experience in SAP Basis administration, including system installation, configuration, and troubleshooting. - Knowledge of SAP security concepts, role design, and user access management. - Familiarity with ITGC audit and regulatory compliance. - Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. - Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
column11: SAP Basis Administration, GRC SAP, SAP GRC, GRC Implementation, SAP Security
